profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

We're thrilled to see thatPayPalannounced that the latest investment fromPayPal Ventures($5M) was made almost entirely in PayPal USD (PYUSD), PayPal's USD-backed stablecoin issued by Paxos. It's the first time PayPal Ventures used#PYUSDto make an investment, which means today is a big day for PYUSD and the future of stablecoins! 🚀 10,798 followers We are thrilled to announce our newest portfolio company,Mesh! Mesh is a modern embedded finance solution that allows businesses to seamlessly integrate crypto transfers and payments directly into their existing platforms. Our investment in Mesh was made almost entirely in PayPal USD (PYUSD), the Ethereum-based stablecoin thatPayPallaunched last year that is 100% backed by U.S. dollars, short-term U.S. treasuries and similar cash equivalents. This marks the first time that we’ve used PYUSD as the funding instrument for aPayPal Venturesinvestment! Congratulations toBam Azizi,Adam Israeland the entire Mesh team – we are thrilled to support the work you’re doing to foster an open, connected, and secure financial ecosystem. Read more in Fortune here:https://lnkd.in/e-dZAtUpAt PayPal Ventures, we believe that user ownership and asset portability will become critical building blocks of product innovation as financial services continues to evolve, and Mesh is a clear leader in this dynamic landscape. To read more of our thoughts on Mesh and beyond, check out the blog from investorAmman Bhasinbelow and on our website atwww.paypal.vc.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

The team at Paxos is excited to continue growing PYUSD alongside you and the PayPal team! 160,081 followers 🎉 The wait is over. Introducing CoinDesk's#MostInfluential2023.

This annual list (no, it's not a ranking) recognizes the people who, for the better, and sometimes the worse, defined the year in digital assets and Web3.

We recognize 50 honorees and entities, with the top 10 making an outsized impact.

We also asked select digital artists to create NFTs for 10 of the honorees. Each NFT will be up for auction for 24 hours starting at 12 p.m. ET today and a portion of the proceeds will go to The Hunger Project. You can find them over on Transient Labs 👉https://lnkd.in/dkgi8YGcHere's a look at the top 10 👇
• Casey Rodarmor: For shaking up#Bitcoinwith his "Ordinals Theory."
• Ryan Selkis: For building a political fundraising machine for crypto that's ready to sway elections in 2024.
• Jenny Johnson: For being at the forefront of Wall Street's embrace of bitcoin ETFs and crypto technology.
• Lido DAO: For becoming a victim of its own success and attracting criticism as its share of staked $ETH has grown to nearly one-third.
• Paolo Ardoino: For diversifying Tether’s investments after a banner year where the stablecoin giant is on track to profit $4.5 billion.
• Jose Fernandez da Ponte: For helping PayPal unveil its own Ethereum-based U.S. dollar stablecoin.
• Gary Gensler: For having more influence on crypto than any regulator or law enforcement official this year.
• Brian Armstrong: For being the biggest big gun still in the hot seat.
• Sam Altman: For heading ChatGPT and Worldcoin and changing the way we use the internet in 2023.
• Brad Garlinghouse: For emerging triumphant this year in legal cases with big implications for crypto's future.

Check out the full list 👉https://lnkd.in/gtr9rxfR

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output:
1. Technological Advancements: Discusses blockchain's impact on finance and mentions popular blockchains like Ethereum and Solana.
2. Education/Community Engagement: Highlights a webinar replay and an Engineering Summit, focusing on community and learning.
3. Business Strategy/Enterprise Adoption: Talks about financial companies investing in digital assets and blockchain for strategic advantages.
4. Professional Development: Advises on staying updated with blockchain research and hands-on practice with local chains.
5. Market Trends/Enterprise Adoption: Shares a report on how the financial industry is adopting blockchain technology.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify key influencers or accounts whose posts are most engaged with or have a significant following in the cryptocurrency space. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
